content.description: Scramble up 4th class to top of northwest buttress. Be careful of the bolt on the very top and avoid it if possible. You'll know why when you see it.  The top belay anchors are down from the top of the buttress near the hole created by three boulders in between the main formation and the NE buttress. You may want to set up short rap or tagline to get to the anchors, depends on how comfortable you feel descending the 7 ft or so into the pocket. Rap through the hole and climb from the ground back up through.
content.protection: Bolted Anchors for top belay setup.

content.description:
This is the side of Crab Claw that faces the highway. The  Holeinsky Chimney can be seen clearly from the highway. The original approach to Crab Claw used to be parking on Hwy 95 and following a trail up the grey tuff hills leading up to the base. 

  Lots of places to explore new routes. Some routes have been toproped on the north face of the NW Buttress.
